          The global policy is applied to all entities.
Rules apply conditions to the policy as they are applied to specific entities.
This method add exceptions to a rule identified by its name and so increase the scope of the rule.
 void applyRuleToEntities(String ruleUUID, List<String> userUUIDs, List<String> roleUUIDs, List<String> groupUUIDs, List<String> membershipUUIDs, List<String> entityIDs, Map<String,String> options)
          The global policy is applied to all entities.
Rules apply conditions to the policy as they are applied to specific entities.
This method is the way to impose conditions to the general policy for the given entity.
For instance applying rules to a collection of user defines what access the users have or do not have.

          The global policy is applied to all entities.
Rules apply conditions to the policy as they are applied to specific entities.
This method is the way to remove conditions to the general policy for the given entity.
For instance removing rules previously applied to a user (entity) defines what access the user has or does not have.

applyRuleToEntities

void applyRuleToEntities(String ruleUUID,
                         List<String> userUUIDs,
                         List<String> roleUUIDs,
                         List<String> groupUUIDs,
                         List<String> membershipUUIDs,
                         List<String> entityIDs,
                         Map<String,String> options)
                         throws RuleNotFoundException,
                                RemoteException
The global policy is applied to all entities.
Rules apply conditions to the policy as they are applied to specific entities.
This method is the way to impose conditions to the general policy for the given entity.
For instance applying rules to a collection of user defines what access the users have or do not have.

userUUIDs -
roleUUIDs -
groupUUIDs -
membershipUUIDs -
entityIDs -
options - the options map (domain, queyList, user)
Throws:

removeRuleFromEntities

void removeRuleFromEntities(String ruleUUID,
                            List<String> userUUIDs,
                            List<String> roleUUIDs,
                            List<String> groupUUIDs,
                            List<String> membershipUUIDs,
                            List<String> entityIDs,
                            Map<String,String> options)
                            throws RuleNotFoundException,
                                   RemoteException
The global policy is applied to all entities.
Rules apply conditions to the policy as they are applied to specific entities.
This method is the way to remove conditions to the general policy for the given entity.
For instance removing rules previously applied to a user (entity) defines what access the user has or does not have.

Parameters:
ruleUUID -
userUUIDs -
roleUUIDs -
groupUUIDs -
membershipUUIDs -
entityIDs -
options - the options map (domain, queyList, user)
Throws:
RuleNotFoundException
RemoteException
